intro: Neofabricia sericisepala, commonly known as the silky-sepaled grass, is a species of flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with delicate, silky-hair-covered bracts. Its flowers are typically pale green to brown, and it thrives in well-drained soils in open habitats. Neofabricia sericisepala is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem.
